title: Tandoori Chicken Legs
description: Bone-in chicken legs marinated in a yogurt-spice mixture with ginger, garlic and warm Indian spices, then roasted until charred at the edges and juicy inside. Bright lemon and cilantro finish cut through the smoky, mildly spicy flavors for a restaurant-style tandoori experience at home.

ingredients.display_name: bone-in chicken legs (drumstick + thigh attached) - skin removed or left on as preferred
ingredients.notes: pat dry; make 2-3 slashes through skin/meat to help marinade penetrate
use thick yogurt or Greek yogurt
use smoked paprika to add smoky flavor if desired

ingredients.display_name: hot chili powder or cayenne (adjust to taste)

steps.text: Prepare chicken: trim excess fat, pat each chicken leg dry and make 2-3 deep slashes through the meat with a sharp knife to allow marinade penetration.

Make marinade: combine yogurt, lemon juice, oil, grated ginger, minced garlic, garam masala, ground cumin, ground coriander, paprika, chili powder, turmeric, salt and sugar (if using) in a bowl until smooth and uniform.
Coat chicken: rub the marinade thoroughly over and into the slashes of each chicken leg so every piece is evenly covered. Place coated legs in a nonreactive container or resealable bag.
Marinate: refrigerate the coated chicken for at least 4 hours, ideally 8–12 hours or overnight for maximum flavor and tenderness.
Bring to room temperature: remove chicken from fridge 30 minutes before cooking so it cooks evenly.

Preheat oven and broiler: preheat oven to 220°C (430°F). Arrange a rack in the top third of the oven and line a rimmed baking sheet with foil; place a wire rack on the sheet and lightly oil the rack so chicken doesn't stick.

Roast: place chicken legs on the prepared rack, spacing them apart, and roast in the hot oven until the skin is set and beginning to char at the edges and an instant-read thermometer reads 72°C (160°F) in the thickest part, about 25–30 minutes depending on size.
Optional char: for additional char and smoky flavor, switch to broil on high and broil 2–4 minutes per side, watching closely to avoid burning, until edges are slightly blackened.
Rest: remove chicken from oven and let rest 5 minutes so juices redistribute.
Finish and serve: garnish with chopped cilantro and lemon wedges; serve hot with rice, naan or salad.
